intro: Serrafalcus racemosus var. villosus, commonly known as the hairy racemosus, is a flowering plant characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its foliage is typically alternate and has serrated edges, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate watering for optimal growth.
